name: Fed Rate Decision Impact
description: Federal Reserve announces surprise rate cut, triggering cascading effects across financial markets

event_data.event_headline: Fed cuts rates by 0.5%, markets react instantly
event_data.impact_thesis: Lower rates reduce borrowing costs, boosting stocks and crypto while weakening dollar. Historical data shows crypto typically gains 10-20% within weeks of rate cuts

primary_effects.reason: Rate cuts directly weaken dollar by reducing yield differential
Lower Fed rates compress long-term yields immediately

secondary_effects.reason: Weaker dollar makes crypto attractive; historical pattern from 2020-2021
Tech stocks benefit from lower discount rates; P/E expansion likely
Gold rallies on dollar weakness and inflation hedge demand

tertiary_effects.reason: Lower rates improve IPO market conditions; startups accelerate public plans
Lower mortgage rates stimulate housing sector with 3-6 month lag

arbitrage_opportunities.reasoning: Rate cuts happen BECAUSE inflation is contained. Market overpricing inflation risk

contrarian_takes: Market may overreact to tech stocks - not all benefit equally from rate cuts
Bitcoin could disappoint if institutional adoption slows despite favorable macro

cascade_chains.chain: Fed Rate → Dollar → Crypto → Tech Stocks → IPO Market
cascade_chains.rationale: Lower rates weaken dollar, making crypto attractive, boosting tech valuations, improving IPO conditions

cascade_chains.chain: Fed Rate → Yields → Housing → Construction → Materials
cascade_chains.rationale: Rate cuts lower mortgage rates, stimulating housing demand and construction sector

market_impact_forecast.reason: Lower rates historically bullish for crypto
Tech stocks benefit from lower discount rates

key_risks: Inflation concerns could reverse sentiment within days
Regulatory changes could dampen crypto rally
Recession fears may offset rate cut optimism
event_data.educational_takeaway: Interest rates affect asset prices through discount rate mechanism and create multi-stage cascades across asset classes

name: AI Breakthrough Announcement
description: Major tech company announces GPT-5 level breakthrough in AI capabilities

event_data.event_headline: GPT-5 class model demonstrates near-AGI reasoning abilities
event_data.impact_thesis: Advanced AI capabilities accelerate across tech sector, affecting valuations and regulatory outlook. Historical pattern: initial euphoria followed by regulatory scrutiny

primary_effects.reason: Direct beneficiary of breakthrough; validates astronomical valuation
Hardware providers benefit immediately from increased AI compute demand

secondary_effects.market_name: AI startup funding up 30%+ in Q1
secondary_effects.reason: Breakthrough validates AI sector; VCs accelerate deployment
Enterprise adoption accelerates; Microsoft OpenAI partnership benefits

tertiary_effects.reason: Advanced capabilities trigger regulatory urgency; EU AI Act precedent
Companies accelerate AI adoption to reduce costs; GPT-5 replaces more roles

arbitrage_opportunities.reasoning: Even GPT-5 breakthrough doesn't equal AGI. Market conflating capability improvement with full AGI

contrarian_takes: Traditional tech stocks may underperform - value accrues to AI-native companies
Regulation may come faster than market expects, creating volatility

cascade_chains.chain: AI Breakthrough → Tech Stocks → Cloud Revenue → Enterprise Software → Job Market
cascade_chains.rationale: Breakthrough drives tech rally, increases cloud adoption, transforms enterprise software, impacts employment

key_risks: Breakthrough capabilities may be exaggerated in initial demos
Regulatory backlash could accelerate faster than expected
Competitive response from Meta/Google could limit OpenAI gains
event_data.educational_takeaway: Technology breakthroughs create multi-stage market cascades with regulatory backlash as a common tertiary effect

name: Election Poll Shift
description: Surprise polling shift in key swing states ahead of presidential election

event_data.event_headline: Polling shows unexpected 5-point swing toward Republican in PA, MI, WI
event_data.impact_thesis: Electoral probabilities shift dramatically, affecting policy-sensitive markets and sector rotations

primary_effects.reason: Swing state polls are leading indicators; 5-point shift is statistically significant

secondary_effects.reason: Republican platform less favorable to renewable subsidies
Republican administration typically more fossil fuel friendly

tertiary_effects.reason: Republican control increases odds of healthcare policy changes

arbitrage_opportunities.reasoning: Swing state shifts suggest close race, not landslide. Market overreacting

contrarian_takes: Polling error remains high - 2016/2020 taught markets to be skeptical
Late campaign developments could easily reverse this trend

cascade_chains.chain: Poll Shift → Election Odds → Policy Markets → Sector Rotation → Stock Picks
cascade_chains.rationale: Different candidates favor different policies and sectors; markets price in new regime

market_impact_forecast.reason: Republican candidate less favorable to renewables

key_risks: Polling error remains significant (3-4 points typical)
Late campaign events (debates, scandals) could reverse trend
Early voting data may contradict polls
event_data.educational_takeaway: Political events cascade through policy expectations to market sectors, with timing based on election proximity

name: COVID Stimulus Rally
description: Massive fiscal stimulus bill passes in March 2020, reversing the pandemic selloff and sparking a cross-asset recovery

event_data.event_headline: US approves $2.2T CARES Act, unleashing historic stimulus
event_data.impact_thesis: Coordinated fiscal and monetary stimulus backstops risk assets, igniting one of the fastest rebounds in modern market history. Liquidity drives hunt for yield across equities and crypto.

primary_effects.reason: Fiscal stimulus plus Fed QE stabilized credit markets and restored risk appetite
Unlimited QE commitments expanded Fed assets at record pace

secondary_effects.reason: Liquidity plus inflation hedging narrative drove crypto demand
Low rates and stimulus checks boosted home demand

tertiary_effects.reason: Easy money environment encouraged speculative capital raising
Stimulus checks and zero commissions accelerated participation

arbitrage_opportunities.reasoning: Demand shock was muted by lockdowns; inflation surge lagged until 2021

contrarian_takes: Stimulus delayed corporate bankruptcies, creating zombie risk
Liquidity-driven rally disconnected from real economy, sowing future volatility

cascade_chains.chain: Stimulus Bill → Credit Markets → Equities → Crypto → Speculative Assets
cascade_chains.rationale: Liquidity stabilized credit spreads, enabling equity rebound and speculative rotation

market_impact_forecast.reason: Liquidity plus forward guidance supported risk premium compression
Institutional inflows accelerated amid macro hedge narrative

key_risks: Second pandemic wave could have interrupted recovery
Political gridlock on follow-up stimulus risked growth cliff
event_data.educational_takeaway: Massive policy responses can reverse market crashes rapidly; understanding liquidity transmission is critical for timing recoveries

name: GameStop Short Squeeze
description: Retail traders coordinated through social media force a historic short squeeze in GameStop during January 2021

event_data.event_headline: GME shares surge over 1500% in two weeks as shorts scramble
event_data.impact_thesis: Crowdsourced retail flows exposed vulnerabilities in heavily shorted names, driving brokers to adjust margin policies and market makers to manage risk tightly.

primary_effects.reason: Short interest exceeded float, creating squeeze dynamics
Volatility forced brokers to conserve capital and limit exposure

secondary_effects.reason: Retail capital rotated into other high short interest names
Market makers hedged gamma exposure, elevating implied volatility

tertiary_effects.reason: Congressional hearings scrutinized retail trading pipelines
Short covering losses crippled concentrated funds

arbitrage_opportunities.market_name: GME falls back below $100 by mid-2021
arbitrage_opportunities.reasoning: Price divorced from fundamentals; eventual mean reversion likely once squeeze abates

contrarian_takes: Order flow restrictions would erode retail trust and participation
Hedge funds would adopt stricter short concentration limits, reducing future squeezes

cascade_chains.chain: Short Squeeze → Broker Margin Calls → Volatility Spike → Regulatory Scrutiny → Industry Adaptation
cascade_chains.rationale: Extreme price moves forced brokers to adjust risk controls, triggering wider market volatility and policy review

market_impact_forecast.reason: Continuation of squeeze and covering pressure

key_risks: Broker trading halts undermined squeeze momentum
Liquidity providers hedged aggressively, capping upside
Regulatory crackdown risked structural changes to retail trading
event_data.educational_takeaway: Extreme short interest can create explosive cascades, but structural frictions (margin, clearing) dictate sustainability of speculative rallies

name: Energy Shock After Ukraine Invasion
description: Russia invades Ukraine in February 2022, triggering surging energy prices and supply chain disruptions

event_data.event_headline: Brent crude spikes above $120 as war disrupts supply chains
event_data.impact_thesis: Geopolitical conflict constrains energy supply, driving commodity inflation, shifting capital to defensive sectors, and accelerating energy policy debates.

primary_effects.reason: Supply shock expectations repriced crude immediately

primary_effects.market_name: European natural gas hits record highs
primary_effects.reason: Dependence on Russian gas created acute scarcity

secondary_effects.reason: Energy pass-through drove broad inflationary pressures

tertiary_effects.reason: Energy security concerns accelerated transition policies

tertiary_effects.market_name: FAO food price index hits all-time high
tertiary_effects.reason: Ukraine and Russia grain export disruptions compounded energy costs

arbitrage_opportunities.market_name: EU mandates nationwide gas rationing in 2022
arbitrage_opportunities.reasoning: Governments sourced alternative LNG supplies; rationing avoided despite tightness

contrarian_takes: Oil supply adjusted faster than expected via US shale and SPR releases
Demand destruction from high prices created lagged downside risks

cascade_chains.chain: War → Energy Supply Shock → Inflation Surge → Central Bank Tightening → Growth Slowdown
cascade_chains.rationale: Commodity spikes transmitted through inflation channels provoking policy response and growth risks

market_impact_forecast.reason: Energy and food pass-through made high CPI readings likely
Policy response to inflation required rapid hikes

key_risks: Escalation risk could have triggered broader supply disruptions
Global recession risk if energy shock persisted
Policy missteps from central banks balancing inflation vs. growth
event_data.educational_takeaway: Geopolitical shocks propagate through commodity markets into inflation and monetary policy, demonstrating how supply-side cascades differ from demand-driven events
